items.q: Which country won the very first FIFA World Cup held in 1930?
items.explanation: Uruguay hosted the tournament and defeated Argentina 4-2 in the final.

items.q: The diameter of a standard golf hole is exactly 4.25 inches.
items.explanation: This specific measurement was standardized by the Royal and Ancient Golf Club of St Andrews in 1893.

items.q: A perfect break in snooker scores 147 points, but it is mathematically possible to score 155 points in a single break under specific foul conditions.
items.explanation: A 'free ball' awarded before any reds are potted allows an extra color to be potted for 1 point plus a color (up to 7), before the standard 147 clearance.

items.q: In Major League Baseball, who holds the record for the most career strikeouts as a pitcher?
items.explanation: He amassed an incredible 5,714 strikeouts over his 27-season career.

items.q: What is the name of the challenging cycling race often called 'The Hell of the North'?
items.explanation: It is famous for its exceptionally rough terrain and extensive use of grueling cobblestone sectors (pavé).

items.q: In the decathlon, what is uniquely the final event on the second day of competition?
items.explanation: It is the only middle-distance running event in the decathlon, severely testing athletes' remaining endurance.

items.q: What legendary boxer famously originated the 'rope-a-dope' fighting style?
items.explanation: He used it famously to exhaust George Foreman during 'The Rumble in the Jungle' in 1974.

items.q: In sumo wrestling, what is the specific Japanese term for the elevated clay ring where bouts take place?
items.explanation: It is constructed of a specific type of clay mixed with sand, uniquely built for each tournament.

items.q: Which NFL franchise holds the record for the most Super Bowl appearances (not necessarily victories)?
items.explanation: They have appeared in 11 Super Bowls, winning 6 of them.

items.q: What highly technical sailing maneuver involves entirely pivoting the bow of the boat through the wind to change direction?
items.explanation: This contrasts with 'jibing', where the stern of the boat passes directly through the wind.
